com.mashery.http

Interface MutableParamGroup

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<String>, ParamGroup
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MutableHTTPHeaderElements, MutableHTTPHeaders

    public interface MutableParamGroup
extends ParamGroup
    Mutable parameter group. Adds support for adding, updating, removing, and clearing.
    Restriction
    This interface is not intended to be implemented by clients.
    Restriction
    This interface is not intended to be extended by clients.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(String name, String value)
      Adds a new parameter with the given name and value.
      void clear()
      Removes all parameters in this group.
      MutableParamIterator iterator()
      Returns an immutable iterator over the parameters in this group.
      void remove(String name)
      Removes all parameters with the given name.
      void set(String name, String value)
      Updates the value of an existing parameter with the given name.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.mashery.http.ParamGroup

        contains, get

      • iterator

        MutableParamIterator iterator()
        Description copied from interface: ParamGroup

      • set

        void set(String name,
       String value)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Updates the value of an existing parameter with the given name. If no such parameter exists, a new one is added. If multiple parameters match the name, only one is updated and the remaining ones are removed. Specific subtypes define their own name matching rules and exactly which parameter instance, if there are more than one with a matching name, is updated.
        Parameters:
        name - parameter name
        value - parameter value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either the name or the value are not allowed

      • add

        void add(String name,
       String value)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a new parameter with the given name and value.
        Parameters:
        name - parameter name
        value - parameter value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either the name or the value are not allowed

      • remove

        void remove(String name)
        Removes all parameters with the given name. Specific subtypes define their own name matching rules.
        Parameters:
        name - parameter name

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all parameters in this group.
